page.title: 14ISOLATION IN THE SAMPFORDS
page.content: This area is very isolated. There is very little evidence of good roads but there are several smaller roads and footpaths. The better roads lead to the neighbouring villages of Radwinter, Finchingfield, Little Bardfield and Wimbish. One road leads to the small town of Thaxted. The small roads all lead to the farms or farmhouses which have been converted into private dwellings. The footpaths too are across farmland and link the farms. In the area that once was a airfield, there is no evidence at all of roads or footpaths. Therefore the inhabitants are very isolated. Some form of transport is needed in order to reach the main part of the village where the many activities are taking place. The children have to be brought to school by mini_bus or in private cars.
